value.title: AI company Staqu collaborates with Microsoft to bring ‘JARVIS’ on Azure
value.excerpt: AI implementation company, Staqu has collaborated with Microsoft to bring its video analytics solutions on Microsoft Azure. The collaboration enables Staqu’s proprietary video analytics solutions including JARVIS (Joint AI Research for Video Instances and Streams) to be integrated with Azure Kubernetes Service and Azure Stack Edge.

value.title: Ancient Chinese terracotta warrior brought to life by coder using artificial intelligence algorithms
value.excerpt: An indie game developer uses computer tools to create a video of realistic-looking historic figures in motion based on portraits and sculptures.

value.title: Latest NVIDIA SHIELD Update Brings AI Upscaling Enhancements And New Features
value.excerpt: Over and above the excellent hardware, NVIDIA has been religious about consistently releasing updates for the SHIELD TV that only make what was already a great device even better.

value.title: How facial recognition technology could be utilized in a COVID-19 world
value.excerpt: It's not science fiction or the movies; facial recognition technology is now part of our world. TensorMark Inc., a US cloud-based AI and computer vision technology provider, is working with University Hospitals to come up with a way to make it work during the COVID-19 pandemic.

value.title: Learn from the first place winner of the first AWS DeepComposer Chartbusters Bach to the Future Challenge
value.excerpt: AWS is excited to announce the winner of the first AWS DeepComposer Chartbusters Challenge, Catherine Chui. value.title: This tiny AI chip obliterates Google rival in a crucial metric
value.excerpt: Kneron, a startup from California, has introduced its new neural processing unit (NPU) for edge AI applications. The KL720 NPU promises to enable sophisticated AI-enhanced applications that do not use the cloud,

value.title: Algorithmia unveils MLops for teams
value.excerpt: Algorithmia Teams delivers machine learning operations and management for small groups as a pay-as-you-go cloud service

value.title: How machine learning is identifying and tracking pandemics like COVID-19
value.excerpt: BlueDot's machine learning platform anticipates the spread and impact of over 150 different pathogens, toxins, and syndromes in near-real time.

value.title: How a Scots Wikipedia scandal highlighted AI’s data problem
value.excerpt: A Reddit user discovered that most articles aren't written in Scots, raising questions for AI models trained on Wikipedia data.

value.title: AI buoyed businesses during the pandemic, and could accelerate permanent change
value.excerpt: IPSoft found that most businesses plan to return furloughed workers to their jobs, but many think AI will change or eliminate those positions within the next two years, white-collar included.

value.title: Kneron launches its new AI chip to challenge Google and others
value.excerpt: Fresh off a $40 million Series A round, edge AI specialist Kneron today announced the launch of its newest custom chip, the Kneron KL 720 SoC. With funding from the likes of Alibaba, Sequoia, Horizons Ventures,

value.title: Move.ai enables AI motion capture without the hassle for video game production
value.excerpt: Move.ai can use artificial intelligence to capture a 3D representation of an actor in a process known as markerless motion capture.

value.title: Amazon Launches an AI-Powered Health and Wellness Band Called Halo
value.excerpt: Amazon has today signaled its intention to grab a share of the fitness tracker market by introducing Amazon Halo —a health and wellness band combined with a "suite of AI-powered health features" accessed via the Halo app on Android or iOS.

value.title: Porn Site Stripchat Inadvertently Discovers Next Best Use Case For AI
value.excerpt: Stripchat, a live camming platform that boasts over 60 million visits per month, has launched a new AI service tool that might just provide us with a glimpse into the next service area of deep machine learning and AI.

value.title: PopID’s face-based payments pose privacy and security risks
value.excerpt: PopID, a face-based payments tech vendor intent on expanding across the U.S., has problematic privacy and security policies.

value.title: ProteanTecs raises $45 million to apply AI to chip design and performance monitoring
value.excerpt: Startup ProteanTecs raised $45 million to further develop its AI chip design platform, bringing its total raised to nearly $100 million.

value.title: Federal contractor taps Google Cloud AI and ML to inspect US Navy vessels
value.excerpt: Simple Technology Solutions will be working with Google Cloud to modernize the maintenance and repairs inspection process for Navy vessels and facilities.

value.title: Graph, machine learning, hype and beyond: ArangoDB open source multi model database releases version 3.7
value.excerpt: A sui generis, multi-model open source database, designed from the ground up to be distributed. ArangoDB keeps up with the times and uses graph, and machine learning, as the entry points for its offering.

value.title: Machine Learning as a Service (MLaaS) Market Growth Probability, Key Vendors and Future Scenario Up To 2027
value.excerpt: According to the study carried out by Acumen Research & Consulting, The Machine Learning as a Service (MLaaS) Market is projected to grow at noteworthy growing CAGR over the forecast period 2020 to 2027.

value.title: University of Illinois to head two of artificial intelligence institutes in the U.S
value.excerpt: The National Science Foundation and the U.S. Department of Agriculture's National Institute of Food and Agriculture are announcing an investment of more than $140 million to establish seven artificial intelligence institutes in the U.

value.title: Microsoft, PNNL and UW leap into White House’s $1B initiative for AI and quantum research
value.excerpt: Microsoft, the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory and the University of Washington are part of a $1 billion effort to study AI and quantum computing.

value.title: Clearview AI CEO says ‘over 2,400 police agencies’ are using its facial recognition software
value.excerpt: More than 2,400 police agencies have entered contracts with Clearview AI, a controversial facial recognition firm, according to comments made by Clearview AI CEO Hoan Ton-That in an interview with Jason Calacanis on YouTube.
